title: Problems on resolving dependencies if GOPATH inside project directory
body:
Hi,

I had some problems on resolving dependencies of my project if `$GOTPATH` is inside my project directory:
Project: /home/user/project/
GOPATH: /home/user/project/go

I wanted to resolve dependencies with 
```bash
$ GOPATH=/home/user/project/go/ go get -v -d ./...
```
but some errors like "... cannot find package ..." appears. If I run rerun this command some times it will work...

If I changed `GOPATH` to /tmp/go all is working fine!

Maybe this is a bug or it is unwanted to place dependencies inside project dir...

/ARO
